statements.name: PROC DFIL
statements.help:
PROC DFIL <options>;                 
	BANDPASS  LOWER=number UPPER=number ORDER=number<options></ ftype>;                 
	BANDSTOP  LOWER=number UPPER=number ORDER=number<options></ ftype>;                 
	HIGHPASS  LOWER=number ORDER=number<options></ ftype>;                 
	LOWPASS  UPPER=number ORDER=number<options></ ftype>;

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: suppresses the generation of ODS outputs

statements.name: BANDPASS
statements.description: specifies the parameters for designing a bandpass digital filter
statements.help: BANDPASS  LOWER=*number* UPPER=*number* ORDER=*number*<options></ ftype>;                                              BANDPASS  ESTIMATE=(*suboptions*) <options></ ftype>

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the order of the digital filter, where number is a positive integer scalar

arguments.name: LOWER=
arguments.description: specifies the lower cutoff frequency {c1} of the bandpass filter, where number is between 0 and 1, with 1 corresponding to the normalized Nyquist frequency (π rad/sample)

arguments.name: UPPER=
arguments.description: specifies the upper cutoff frequency {c2} of the bandpass filter, where number is between 0 and 1, with 1 corresponding to the normalized Nyquist frequency (π rad/sample)

arguments.name: ESTIMATE=
arguments.description: specifies the parameters to use to estimate the minimum required order to meet the filter design specifications and to calculate the lower and upper cutoff frequencies of the filter
arguments.help: ESTIMATE=(PASS1=*number* PASS2=*number* STOP1=*number* STOP2=*number* RP=*number* RS=*number*)

arguments.name: PASS1=
arguments.description: specifies the lower passband edge frequency of the bandpass filter {p1}, where number is between 0 and 1, with 1 corresponding to the normalized Nyquist frequency (π rad/sample)

arguments.name: PASS2=
arguments.description: specifies the upper passband edge frequency of the bandpass filter {p2}, where number is between 0 and 1, with 1 corresponding to the normalized Nyquist frequency (π rad/sample)

arguments.name: STOP1=
arguments.description: specifies the lower stopband edge frequency of the bandpass filter {s1}, where number is between 0 and 1, with 1 corresponding to the normalized Nyquist frequency (π rad/sample)

arguments.name: STOP2=
arguments.description: specifies the upper stopband edge frequency of the bandpass filter {s2}, where number is between 0 and 1, with 1 corresponding to the normalized Nyquist frequency (π rad/sample)

arguments.name: RP=
arguments.description: specifies the passband ripple, which is expressed in decibels (dB), where number is a positive scalar

arguments.name: RS=
arguments.description: specifies the stopband attenuation, which is expressed in decibels (dB), where number is a positive scalar

arguments.name: CODE=
arguments.description: generates SAS DATA step code that mimics the computations that are done by using the designed digital filter to filter any input data

arguments.name: FILE=
arguments.description: specifies the filename of the file to write the SAS DATA step code to, where filename can be a quoted string that contains the path of the file in which to store the code or a fileref that refers to an external file in which to save code

arguments.name: IVAR=
arguments.description: specifies a list of input variables, each of which contains a vector of data to be filtered by the designed digital filter

arguments.name: SVAR=
arguments.description: specifies a list of output variables, each of which contains a filtered output data vector

arguments.name: SAVESTATE=
arguments.description: creates an analytic store for the designed digital filter and saves it as a binary object in a data table

arguments.name: RSTORE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table in which to save the analytic store of the designed filter

arguments.name: IVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the input variable, which contains a vector of data to be filtered by the designed digital filter

arguments.name: SVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the output variable, which contains a filtered output data vector

arguments.name: DBT=
arguments.description: specifies the magnitude threshold, which is expressed in decibels (dB), of the frequency response to display in the frequency response plot, where number is a positive scalar

arguments.name: BUTTER
arguments.description: designs a Butterworth bandpass filter

arguments.name: CHEB1
arguments.description: designs a Chebyshev type I bandpass filter

arguments.name: CHEB2
arguments.description: a Chebyshev type II bandpass filter

statements.name: HIGHPASS
statements.description: specifies the parameters for designing a highpass digital filter
statements.help: HIGHPASS  LOWER=*number* ORDER=*number*<options></ ftype>;                                              HIGHPASS  ESTIMATE=(*suboptions*) <options></ ftype>

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the order of the digital filter, where number is a positive integer scalar

arguments.name: LOWER=
arguments.description: specifies the cutoff frequency {c} of the highpass filter, where number is between 0 and 1, with 1 corresponding to the normalized Nyquist frequency (π rad/sample)

arguments.name: ESTIMATE=
arguments.description: specifies the parameters to use to estimate the minimum required order to meet the filter design specifications and to calculate the cutoff frequency of the filter

arguments.name: PASS1=
arguments.description: specifies the passband edge frequency of the highpass filter {p}, where number is between 0 and 1, with 1 corresponding to the normalized Nyquist frequency (π rad/sample)

arguments.name: STOP1=
arguments.description: specifies the stopband edge frequency of the highpass filter {s}, where number is between 0 and 1, with 1 corresponding to the normalized Nyquist frequency (π rad/sample)

arguments.name: RP=

arguments.name: RS=
arguments.description: specifies the stopband attenuation, which is expressed in decibels (dB), where number is a positive scalar

arguments.description: generates SAS DATA step code that mimics the computations that are done by using the designed digital filter to filter any input data

arguments.name: FILE=
arguments.description: specifies the filename of the file to write the SAS DATA step code to, where filename can be a quoted string that contains the path of the file in which to store the code or a fileref that refers to an external file in which to save code

arguments.name: DBT=

arguments.name: BUTTER
arguments.description: designs a Butterworth highpass filter

arguments.name: CHEB1
